titleStmt.title: I.E. Spafford v. Territory of Washington King County. Order of the Court

bibl.title: I.E. Spafford v. Territory of Washington King County. Order of the Court
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle

body.p: United States of America Territory of Washington }ss. County of King
To any constable + the of the County jail of said County.

as a Justice Court held this day at my office in said County for the examination of I.E. Spafford for the alleged offense of having on March 22d in said County felonuously administered a certain dangerous and deleterious drug to one Fanse Spafford, then and there being pregnant with a quick child with intent and for the purpose of causing an abortion and destroy said child, the said administration not being necessary to save the life of said mother whereby and by reason of said administration the said Fanse Spafford did die and upon an arrangement of said defendant did waive examination and by me adjudged to give bail in the sum of $500.00 for his appearance at the next term of the District Court to be held at Seattle in said County on the last Monday in May 1887 and the defendant hereby failed and refused to furnish said bonds

it was adjudged and ordered that he be committed to the jail of said King County until he furnished said bail or until he be discharged by law therefrom, you the said constable are commanded in the name of the W.S. Forthwith to convey and deliver the said I.E. Spafford to the said keeps and you, the said keeper, are hereby commanded to secure the said I.E. Spafford into your custody in said jail and him there safely until he furnishes said bonds or until he thence be discharged by due court of law
K.A. Onturas Justice of the people
Office of the Sheriff of King County Washington Territory
I William Cochrane Sheriff of King County do hereby certify that the within is a correct & true copy of the commitment of I.E. Spafford now in my office.
Dated at Seattle King County this 12th day of April 1887 William Lochram Sheriff
